formal_spec: connected(G) ⇔ ∀n₁, n₂ ∈ N: ∃ path from n₁ to n₂
∀o ∈ objects: visual(o) = semantic(o) Changes to visual representation directly modify semantic content.
∀i ∈ Input: store(i) ⇒ validator(i) = Valid No invalid input reaches storage
∀v ∈ Valid: normalizer(v) produces consistent Internal format
∀p ∈ ParsedData: transformer(p) conforms to internal schema
∀d ∈ InternalData: integrator(d) applies merge strategy consistently
∀e₁, e₂ ∈ Stream: timestamp(e₁) < timestamp(e₂) ⇒ process_order(e₁) < process_order(e₂)
∀n ∈ graph: recompute(n) ⇔ (invalidated(n) ∨ ∃d ∈ dependencies(n): invalidated(d)) Only recompute what changed
∀b ∈ BaseData: base_fields(combine(b, enrichments)) = b Original data preserved
∀e₁, e₂ ∈ enrichers: e₁ and e₂ can execute in parallel
failure(enricher_i) ⇏ failure(entire_flow) Flow continues with available enrichments
∃transform: simplify(T) = T' where semantics(T) = semantics(T') ∧ complexity(T') ≤ complexity(T)
visible(n) ⇒ visible(parent(n)) Expanding parent makes children visible.
expand(n) → load_children(n) only when n first expanded
lim_{t→∞} improvement(model_t) → 0 Eventually reaches optimal or near-optimal
∀d ∈ Data: validate(d) finds all violations according to defined rules
∀adjustments: system remains stable after applying adjustments No oscillation or divergence
∀u ∈ Users: preferences(u) stored with user consent ∧ anonymizable
∀p ∈ Preferences: score(p, t) = score(p, 0) · decay_function(t) Old preferences have less weight
extend(M, k, v) → M' where keys(M'.data) = keys(M.data) ∪ {k}
Mode 1 (immediate): onChange → commit Mode 2 (delayed): onChange → stage, onBlur → commit
state changes → render(state) → diff → patch → updated DOM Automatic propagation
∀s₁, s₂ ∈ State: patch(diff(render(s₁), render(s₂))) applies minimal changes
∀s ∈ State: visual_output(s) = render(s) What you see reflects state
∀u ∈ Users, n ∈ Notifications: deliver(n, channel) only if user_allows(u, channel, type(n))
∀d ∈ Data: publish(d) succeeds completely ∨ rolls back completely
∀s ∈ states: s is immutable once committed
branch(s, name) creates new branch from state s
close(tab) ∧ dirty(tab) → confirm("Unsaved changes. Close anyway?")
∀e ∈ Error: classify(e) determines appropriate recovery strategy Transient → Retry Permanent → Report Recoverable → Fallback | GracefulDegradation
∀e ∈ Error: recover(e) preserves system invariants No partial state corruption
path = [root, child₁, child₂, ..., current] where childᵢ ∈ children(childᵢ₋₁)
results sorted by ranker(item, query) descending
Agents execute tasks independently without coordination
∀task ∈ tasks: ∃agent, time: agent executes task at time
tasks distributed evenly across idle agents
step_i depends on step_j ⇒ j < i (executed before)
get(key) completes in O(1) average time
Atomicity: Transactions complete fully or not at all Consistency: Constraints always satisfied Isolation: Concurrent transactions don't interfere Durability: Committed changes persist
Queries expressed as: SELECT, PROJECT, JOIN, UNION, DIFFERENCE
traverse(node, depth) in O(k·d) where k = avg degree, d = depth
Both nodes and edges can have properties
Documents in same collection can have different structures
Documents can contain nested objects and arrays
range(t1, t2) uses binary search: O(log n + k) where k = result size
Publishers don't know subscribers Subscribers don't know publishers
One event → multiple subscribers One subscriber → multiple topics
publish(event) returns immediately Delivery happens asynchronously
Only send deltas, not full state
Each request independent No server-side session required (often)
GET, PUT, DELETE are idempotent Multiple identical requests = same result as single request
2xx: Success 3xx: Redirection 4xx: Client error 5xx: Server error
buffer full → pause producer → wait → resume producer
Producer sends EndOfStream → consumer processes remaining chunks → close
∃! store: all application state in store
reducer(state, action) returns new state, doesn't mutate old state
All executed commands pushed to undo_stack
Subject doesn't know observer details Observers independent of each other
Plugins isolated from each other Plugin failure doesn't crash system
Handler error doesn't prevent other handlers from running
Can change strategy at runtime without recompilation
∀p_i, p_j ∈ P: δ₃₅(p_i, p_j) = splitter ⇔ adjacent(p_i, p_j)
selection changes → content := φ₃₆(selection) ∀s ∈ Element: content = φ₃₆(s) when selection = s
selection := new_selection ⇒ notify_observers(SelectionEvent) All observers automatically receive update
selection = null ⇒ content = empty_state | default_content Panel handles empty selection gracefully
∀m₁, m₂ ∈ Menus: m₁ ≠ m₂ ⇒ ¬(σ₃₉(m₁) = open ∧ σ₃₉(m₂) = open)
transition(m_i, m_j) succeeds ⇔ δ₄₀(m_i, m_j) = allowed
σ₄₁(success) = green σ₄₁(warning) = yellow σ₄₁(error) = red σ₄₁(info) = blue
Transitions: collapsed ↔ expanded expanded ↔ pinned collapsed ↔ pinned
∀k₁, k₂: k₁ ≠ k₂ ⇒ B(k₁) ≠ B(k₂) ∨ scope(k₁) ∩ scope(k₂) = ∅
P(Mac): Ctrl ↦ Cmd, Alt ↦ Option P(Windows): identity P(Linux): identity
validate_async(field) → ValidationResult (eventually) state[field] = Validating during execution
validate_group([field₁, field₂, ...]) → ValidationResult Example: password confirmation
Navigate away → persist(data, current) Return → restore(data, current)
∀i < current: can_goto(i)  // Can revisit completed steps
deps forms a DAG (no circular dependencies)
breakpoints ordered: mobile < tablet < desktop < wide
result = {item ∈ data : ∀(k, v) ∈ active: filters[k].apply(item, v)}
Multiple filters combined with AND (intersection) Multi-select within filter combined with OR (union)
Items with equal sort keys maintain their original relative order
Sort by order[0], then order[1] for ties, then order[2], ...
comparator respects type semantics: Numeric: 2 < 10 String: "a" < "b" (lexicographic) Date: older < newer
|visible| ≪ |data| Only render items in viewport ± buffer
Migration completes fully or rolls back
versions totally ordered: v₁ < v₂ < v₃ < ...
Passwords stored as secure hashes, never plaintext
Default deny: access denied unless explicitly allowed
Explicit deny overrides allow Multiple policies combined with AND
Group permissions inherited by members Parent resource permissions inherited by children
Allow known-good patterns rather than blocking known-bad
HTML context → HTML encode SQL context → Parameterized queries URL context → URL encode
Unit tests run independently No shared state between tests
Unit tests complete in milliseconds No I/O, network, or database
Each test verifies one behavior Clear failure messages
May use real databases, APIs, file systems Or test doubles (test DB, mock APIs)
Execution time: seconds (vs milliseconds for unit tests)
Tests complete system from user perspective Real browser, real UI, real backend
Tests realistic user workflows Example: Register → Login → Purchase → Logout
Execution time: seconds to minutes Run less frequently than unit/integration tests
$\forall t \in stream : \exists \Delta UI : render(t) = \Delta UI$ (incremental rendering per token)
$\forall spec \in \text{ComponentSpec} : spec.template \in T_{lib}$ (only valid templates used)
$\forall c_1, c_2 \in \text{Context} : c_1 \neq c_2 \implies R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c_1)) \neq R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c_2))$ (distinct contexts → distinct UIs)
$\forall s \in U_{state} : \text{adapt}(c) \implies U_{state}' \supseteq s$ (state persists across adaptations)
$\forall c \in \text{Context} : \exists v \in T_{ui} : R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c)) = v$ (complete coverage)
$\forall t_1, t_2 : t_1 < t_2 \implies \text{Revealed}_{t_1} \subseteq \text{Revealed}_{t_2}$ (never hide revealed info)
$\forall n_1, n_2 : score_{rel}(n_1) > score_{rel}(n_2) \implies t_{reveal}(n_1) \leq t_{reveal}(n_2)$ (high relevance first)
$\forall n, c : c \in \text{children}(n) \implies t_{reveal}(n) < t_{reveal}(c)$ (hierarchical order)
$\forall a \in \text{ActiveAgents} : a \in A_{roster}$ (all active agents visualized)
$\forall a \in Agents : \exists e \in Events : e.agent = a$ (all agents have events)
$\forall e_1, e_2 : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies e_1.timestamp < e_2.timestamp$
$\forall s \in \Sigma_{state} : \text{handoff}(A_{from}, A_{to}, s) \implies s' = s$ (no state loss)
$\text{handoff}(A_{from}, A_{to}) \implies \exists t : \text{owner}(\text{task}, t^-) = A_{from} \land \text{owner}(\text{task}, t^+) = A_{to}$
$\forall t \in \text{Tasks} : r^* = \arg\max_{r \in R_{available}} M_{match}(r, t)$ (best match)
$\forall t : t.\text{requirements} \subseteq r^*.\text{capabilities}$ where $r^*$ is selected role
$\forall a : \text{failing}(a) \implies \exists r' : A_{assign}(r', t) = a'$ (can reassign on failure)
$\forall a_1, a_2 : exec(compose([a_1, a_2])) = exec(a_2) \circ exec(a_1)$ (sequential composition)
$\forall a \in A_{atomic} : \exists u : a.\text{undo} = u$ (every action has undo)
$\forall t : \exists s \in S_{stream} : s.\text{timestamp} = t$ (always monitoring)
$\forall i \in \text{Interventions} : t_{intervene}(i) < t_{need}(i)$ (intervenes before need arises)
$\forall t : I_{speech}(t) \land O_{speech}(t)$ can occur simultaneously (bidirectional)
$\forall span \in \text{Content} : \exists s \in Sources : Inline_{refs}(span) = s.id$ (every claim cited)
$\forall s \in Sources : s.confidence \in [0,1]$ is visible to user
$\forall (n_i, e_i) \in Path_{retrieval} : \text{explain}(e_i) \to \text{why } n_{i} \to n_{i+1}$ (each hop justified)
$\forall n_i, n_{i+1} \in Path_{retrieval} : Score_{relevance}(n_{i+1}) \leq Score_{relevance}(n_i)$ (decreasing along path)
$\forall i : \exists e \in \text{Edges} : e.source = n_i \land e.target = n_{i+1}$ (valid graph path)
$\forall span \in Text : \exists c \in [0,1] : Conf_{scores}(span) = c$ (every span has confidence)
$\forall i, j : i < j \implies Thresholds[i] < Thresholds[j]$ (increasing sequence)
$\forall t_i, t_{i+1} \in Thresholds : \Delta E(Colors(t_i), Colors(t_{i+1})) > \tau$ (perceptually distinct)
$\forall c_1, c_2 \in \text{Claims} : \text{contradicts}(c_1, c_2) \implies (c_1, c_2, t) \in Conflicts$ for some $t$
$\forall c_1, c_2 \in Concepts : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) = Sim_{matrix}(c_2, c_1)$ (symmetric)
$\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) > Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_3) \implies$   $\|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_2)\| < \|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_3)\|$ (spatial proximity reflects similarity)
$\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) < Threshold \implies \neg \text{visible}(\text{edge}(c_1, c_2))$
$\forall e_1, e_2 \in Improvements : e_1 \neq e_2 \implies e_1.span \cap e_2.span = \emptyset$ (disjoint)
$\forall e \in Improvements : \exists r \in \text{String} : e.reason = r \land |r| > 0$ (all edits explained)
$\forall d_1, d_2 \in Docs : Auto_{link}(d_1, d_2) > \theta \implies \exists l \in Relationships : l.source = d_1 \land l.target = d_2$
$\forall l \in Relationships : l.bidirectional = \text{true} \implies \exists l' : l'.source = l.target \land l'.target = l.source$
$\forall span : Freshness(span) = e^{-\lambda \cdot \Delta t}$ where $\Delta t = \text{now}() - \text{lastUpdated}(span)$
$\forall c_1, c_2 \in Contributions : c_1.edit.span \cap c_2.edit.span \neq \emptyset \implies$   $\exists r \in \text{Resolution} : r(c_1, c_2) = c_{merged}$ (CRDT-like)
$\forall a \in Agents : \exists r \in \text{Role} : a.role = r \land \text{expert}(a, r)$
$\forall span \in Document : \exists c \in Contributions : c.edit.span = span$ (traceable authorship)
$\forall v_i, v_{i+1} \in Versions : Timestamps(v_i) < Timestamps(v_{i+1})$ (monotonic time)
$\forall v_{i+1} \in Versions : \exists v_i : v_{i+1}.parent = v_i.id$ (except root version)
$\forall v \in Versions : Contributors(v) \neq \emptyset$ (every change has author)
$\forall v_i \in Versions : v_i = \text{apply}(v_0, \bigoplus_{j=1}^{i} Changes(v_{j-1}, v_j))$ (replay history)
$\forall e \in Events : \Delta t_{display}(e) = t_{render}(e) - e.timestamp < 100ms$ (low latency)
$\forall w \in \text{Windows} : Aggregation(w) = f(\{e \in Events \mid e.timestamp \in w\})$
$\forall e_1, e_2 \in History : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies \text{order}(e_1) < \text{order}(e_2)$ in replay
$\forall \Delta t : |\{e \in \text{processed} \mid e.timestamp \in [t, t + \Delta t]\}| \leq Rate_{control} \times \Delta t$
$\forall e_1, e_2 \in Buffer : P(\text{drop}(e_1)) = P(\text{drop}(e_2))$ (uniform probability)
$\forall e \in Events : Reducer(s, e) = s' \land s \neq s'$ (no mutation, new state returned)
$\forall s, e : Reducer(s, e) = Reducer(s, e)$ (same input → same output)
$\forall s_1, s_2 \in Streams : Merge(\{s_1, s_2\}) = s' \implies$   $\forall e_1 \in s_1, e_2 \in s_2 : e_1.ts < e_2.ts \implies \text{order}(e_1, s') < \text{order}(e_2, s')$
$\forall e_1, e_2 : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies e_1 \text{ appears before } e_2$ in merged stream
$\forall f_1, f_2 \in Filters : \text{compose}(f_1, f_2) = \lambda e. f_1(e) \land f_2(e)$ (conjunction)
$\forall d_1, d_2 \in Domains : d_1 \neq d_2 \implies d_1.\text{schema} \cap d_2.\text{schema} = \emptyset$ (separate contexts)
$\forall a \in \text{Agents} : \exists! d \in Domains : a \in d.\text{agents}$ (unique assignment)
